name: Craft stone pickaxe
goal: Craft a stone pickaxe from cobblestone and sticks using a crafting table
notes: The stone pickaxe is essential for mining iron ore, lapis lazuli ore, and copper ore. You MUST have at least a stone pickaxe to mine iron ore â€” a wooden pickaxe will NOT work. Cobblestone is obtained by mining stone with any pickaxe. Cobbled deepslate can substitute for cobblestone. Blackstone can also substitute. Requires a crafting table.

steps.title: Obtain cobblestone
steps.details: Mine stone blocks with a wooden pickaxe or better to get cobblestone. You need 3 cobblestone. Stone is abundant underground and on hillsides. If you see 'stone' in perception, mine it. Cobbled deepslate (found below Y=0) or blackstone (found in the Nether) also work as substitutes.
checks: Have at least 3 cobblestone (or cobbled_deepslate or blackstone) in inventory
Have a wooden pickaxe or better equipped

steps.title: Craft sticks if needed
steps.details: You need 2 sticks. Craft from 2 planks vertically -> 4 sticks, or from 2 bamboo -> 1 stick. If you already have sticks, skip this step.
checks: Have at least 2 sticks in inventory

steps.title: Craft the stone pickaxe
steps.details: Use a crafting table. Place 3 cobblestone across the top row, then 1 stick in center-middle and 1 stick in center-bottom. Recipe: { "recipe": "stone_pickaxe", "count": 1 }. The stone pickaxe has 131 durability and can mine iron ore, lapis, and copper ore.
